description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eau74","text":"For many marine mammal species, minimal sexual dimorphism means that sex cannot be reliably identified through observation. Instead, genetic analysis of sampled skin and blubber are required to determine an individual's sex. Studies using suction cup tags on free-ranging whales may retrieve exfoliated epidermal tissue from the underside of the tag’s suction cups, offering a valuable source of genetic information. This study provides a protocol for tissue collection and DNA extraction from recovered tag tissue and describe the accuracy of PCR-based sex determination using these methods. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hca5","text":"Prior ethics approval should be obtained before performing this type of research. All work was approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee of Syracuse University (IACUC approval numbers 20-002 and 23-002).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

keywords: Polymerase chain reaction, trace DNA, sex determination, marine mammal
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6bot","text":"MyTaq Extract-PCR Kit (Meridian Bioscience, cat. no. BIO-21126)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkv14","text":"DNEasy Blood and Tissue Kit (Qiagen, cat. no. 69504) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jss0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ccc8","text":"Protocol-specific primers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du2ia","text":"Forward SRY: 5’ CCC ATG AAC GCA TTC ATT GTG TGG 3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vfn1","text":"Reverse SRY: 5’ ATT TTA GCC TTC CGA CGA GGT CGA TA 3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s3rs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55eqs","text":"Forward ZFX: 5’ ATA ATC ACA TGG AGA GCC ACA AGC T 3’ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pfb2","text":"Reverse ZFX: 5’ GCA CTT CTT TGG TAT CTG AGA AAG T 3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: This is a working protocol currently used for sex determination in baleen whales

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c3k0","text":"Retrieve the tag from the water. While retrieving the tag, ensure that nothing touches the suction cups with the exception of the net used for retrieval and wear gloves to prevent contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"47phg","text":"Using fresh nitrile gloves, wipe the inside of the suction cups with a sterile swab, avoiding the outside of the suction cup and any other part of the tag. This reduces the chances of obtaining a sample that is contaminated with the genetic material of another animal that may have come into contact with the tagged animal. Note that suctions cups may not have visible skin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lmm5","text":"Place the swab tip first into a plastic vial, trimming the handle as needed in order to close or screw on the lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1ilr","text":"Clearly label the vial with the date and the identifying information that is associated with that specific deployment. Make sure that there is enough information on the label to ensure that all samples are easily and accurately associated with the respective deployment data. This includes, at a minimum, the ID associated with the tag deployment. For example 'bb22_115a', indicating the two letter species ID (bb), julian day (115), and the order of deployment (a, the first tag of the day).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3tb3","text":"Repeat steps 3 through 6 for the remaining pair of suction cups.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnslt","text":"Move the vial immediately into a   freezer if possible. If no   is available on board the vessel, store on dry ice until the sample can be moved into an appropriate freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9blmn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E030E0C0D23611EDA6D8F5E3495FF03D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E8EEE270D23611EDA6D8F5E3495FF03D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kku1","text":"It is also important to note this information on a datasheet designed to store this data along with other metadata that will be needed later. Of particular importance are:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3orm1","text":"Date the sample was collected","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anj1p","text":"Time the sample was collected","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae5km","text":"Location (latitude and longitude) the sample was collected","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl8im","text":"Group size/proximity to other animals, as these factors may be a source of contamination","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eragk","text":"Add Buffer AW2 to each sample as directed by the manufacturer's protocol and centrifuge samples at   for   to completely dry the column membrane. Discard the resulting flowthrough and collection tube. Place spin column in a clean   collection tube (included in kit). If the bottom of the spin column comes in contact with any flowthrough solution, place spin column in a clean    collection tube and repeat the centrifugation step (  for  )","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e9b8m","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"500","centrifuge":"17000","duration":0,"error":false,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B459F181BFAB11EEA0560A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":34},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"centrifuge"},"2":{"data":{"amount":"500","centrifuge":"8000","duration":180,"error":false,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B459F377BFAB11EEA0560A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":33},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37god","text":"Amplify DNA fragments of interest with 30 cycles of PCR at the following conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30hli","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pljh","text":"    StepTemperatureTimeCyclesInitial Denaturation95 ℃3 min1Denaturation95 ℃15 sec35 Annealing55 ℃15 secExtension72 ℃20 sec","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":122}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ucdm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":""},"colTitles":["Step","Temperature  (°C)","Time (seconds)","Number of cycles"],"colWidths":[100,"129","123","130"],"data":[["y","m","","Cycles"],["Initial Denaturation","95 ℃","180","1"],["Denaturation","95 ℃","15","30"],["Annealing","55 ℃","15",""],["Extension","72 ℃","20",""],["Final extension","72 ℃","300","1"]],"guid":"95FDE2ECD23511ED8CD90A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5f5o3","text":"Table 2: PCR amplification cycles","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{"D_3":[1,3]},"printData":[["y","m","","Cycles"],["Initial Denaturation","95 ℃","180","1"],["Denaturation","95 ℃","15","30"],["Annealing","55 ℃","15",""],["Extension","72 ℃","20",""],["Final extension","72 ℃","300","1"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"couuq","text":"Cast a   agarose gel dyed with SYBR Safe DNA gel stain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"2","error_concentration":false,"guid":"9DEBD9E0D23611EDA6D8F5E3495FF03D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"m3tt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebsuk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3eepj","text":"To begin DNA extraction, remove swab tip from plastic stick. This can be done by tracing a clean razor blade along the connection point from the swab tip to the swab stick. Transfer the swab tip to ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6ak9","text":"a clean 1.5-mL microcentrifuge tube for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehvvb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4o56","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cbi72","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"24un8","text":"DNA extraction was performed with a commercially available kit (DNease Blood \u0026 Tissue Kit, Qiagen, cat. no. 69504). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"59nur","text":"Be sure to use a clean razor blade for each sample to avoid cross-contamination of any genetic material.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvab2","text":"The PCR product will be assessed by gel electrophoresis using the known length of the SRY (210-260 bpd) and ZFX/ZFY (442/445). This protocol is written for use with an EasyCast B1 Mini Gel Electrophoresis system (ThermoFisher).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgid4","text":"Swab two suction cups with one swab, then the other two suction cups with a new sterile swab. Retrieving two samples from the same tag allows for more testing as well as sample security in cases of contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hss3","text":"Re-position gel tray with gel in the buffer chamber of the gel electrophoresis apparatus to the running position (wells should be placed in the chamber so that they are positioned at the negative electrode). Fill the buffer chamber with 1X TAE buffer so that the gel is completely submerged. Remove comb. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ng9h","text":"Load   of 100 bp DNA molecular weight marker (New England Biolabs, cat. no. NEB#B7025) prepared to contain 1X bromophenol blue running dye into the first well (bromophenol blue runs at ~500 bp). Load   of the sample(s) in the following wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":200,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"5B390B00049411EEB2817507FCE7FB93","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"6611AF50049411EEB2817507FCE7FB93","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5npds","text":"Place the lid on the electrophoresis apparatus and ensure that cables are connected to the power supply. Run the gel at 80-100 V under dark conditions. Monitor gel run until the bromophenol blue running dye line has migrated about 1 cm from the midpoint of the gel (~  -  ).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":267,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":270,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9cm37","text":"Once the gel run is complete, resolved DNA fragments may be visualized with a UV transilluminator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pdva","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dc6mj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ckv3m","text":"In this protocol, a ChemiDoc imaging system (Bio-Rad) was used to image the resolved PCR products following separation by gel electrophoresis. The blue tray and the protocol pre-programmed in the instrument for use with SYBR Safe DNA stain was used.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajmkb","text":"The expected molecular weight of the PCR product associated with the SRY gene is 210-260 bp and the expected molecular weight of the PCR product associated with the ZFX/ZFY gene 442-445 bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahcui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22mgs","text":"The presence of the SRY gene suggests that the DNA sample came from a male individual. Females will not possess this gene, and thus this DNA fragment will not be amplified in DNA extracted from a female. However, absence of this gene may be caused by issues in the experimental workflow, such as an insufficient amount of template DNA added, which would result in a false result. To validate the PCR reaction and minimize the chance a false sexing, DNA is also screened simultaneously for a gene that is present in both male and female individuals. The ZFX/ZFY gene serves as a positive control in this protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ba22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98dfq","text":"An expected profile for DNA extracted from a male individual would show the presence of DNA fragments from both the SRY gene (210-260 bp) and the ZFX/ZFY genes (442-445 bp). An expected profile for DNA extracted from a female individual would show presence of only the DNA fragement from the ZFX/ZFY gene (442-445 bp). A sample that showed presence of only the DNA fragment from the SRY gene would suggest non-specific priming and would be considered an inconclusive result.     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sh07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77deg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n1bj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9s84n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"61c7n","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"basj8","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"485ee","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"alt":"","guid":"079AF57CA09F11EF97A80A58A9FEAC02","height":250,"id":565298,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1hfei\",\"text\":\"Figure 1: The results of six samples of extracted DNA, amplified following the protocol described above, and resolved via gel electrophoresis. Samples run in lanes 1, 2, and 4 yielded no bands. Samples run in lanes 3 and 5 show an amplicon profile indicative of a male individual, with two bands at 442-445 bp (magenta arrow) and 210-260 bp (cyan arrow). The sample run in lane 6 shows an amplicon profile indicative of a female individual, with one band resolved at 442-445 bp (magenta arrow), only. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":"step-009E0346FDB5475984B8CA0E5C4B7A5E-nested-draft-4n1bj","original_name":"2024-11-11_Figureforsexingprotocolpaper.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rxdwb8nuf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/tibub8nuf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/tibtb8nuf.webp","width":550},"mutability":"IMMUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36h4u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftt25","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"37ag6","text":"PCR amplification was performed on extracted DNA samples using primers specific to the SRY (sex-determining region Y) and ZFX/ZFY (sex chromosomal zing-finger) genes. Oligonucleotide primers for both of these genes have been validated in other species. Primers were ordered from IDT DNA. {"blocks":[{"key":"cmvr6","text":"Add the amount of Buffer ATL directly to each tube containing swab as directed by the manufacturer's protocol. steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ld3f","text":"Dilute running dye in PCR product mixture to a final concentration of 1X xylene cyanol (runs at ~4000 kbp) by adding    of a 6X xylene cyanol solution to each sample product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"96D4F44CD73911EE86800A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6fmoj","text":"Prepare mold by placing gel tray in the buffer chamber of the electrophoresis apparatus so that the gaskets of the tray form a seal with the walls of the chamber. Use a level to adjust the tray position so that the gel is cast evenly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6dhen","text":"Prepare the 2% agarose solution by combining the appropriate mass of agarose with the appropriate volume of 1X tris-acetate EDTA (TAE) buffer (i.e. for a   agarose gel, combine   agarose in   1X TAE buffer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":154,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":177,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":190,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"118CA540A09811EFAF870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.875","error":false,"guid":"118CA46FA09811EFAF870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"75","error":false,"guid":"118CA4DFA09811EFAF870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis

steps.section: Analysis of PCR product by gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bv912","text":"Once agarose solution is stained, cast immediately in appropriate gel mold. Place a comb in the mold to create a row of wells.
